title: What is the Yonaguni monument? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yonaguni Monument, underwater rock structure that was discovered in the mid-1980s near Yonaguni Island, Japan. While some believe the ziggurat-like formation is from an ancient city, others argue that it was naturally created.  The rectangular monument, which was first detected by a scuba diver, is more than 165 feet (50 metres) long and some 65 feet (20 metres) wide. A number of scholars have visited the site, but its origin remains uncertain. According to some, the monument is a man-made stepped pyramid. Thanks

“Yonaguni Monument” refers to under-sea rock formations off the island of Yonaguni between Taiwan and Okinawa Prefecture of Japan. These formations were claimed to be man-made by a Japanese marine-geologist but has not been acknowledged as such by the scientific community and other authorities in Japan and elsewhere.
